sections.title: On Pseu\b\tga\f\fing in HPSG*
paragraphs: Dong-woo \b\trk
D\fp\trtm\fnt of L\tgu\tg\f \tnd Lit\fr\ttur\f, S\foul N\ttion\tl Univ\frsity
599 Gw\tn\tk-ro, Gw\tn\tk-gu, S\foul 151-742, Kor\f\t

pdw83@snu.\tc.kr Abstract. This study inv\fstig\tt\fs th\f constr\tints impos\fd on th\f ps\fudog\tpping in th\f fr\tm\fwork of H\f\td-Driv\fn \bhr\ts\f Structur\f Gr\tmm\tr (H\bSG). B\ts\fd on th\f \fxisting sch\fm\t to \tccount for coordin\ttion \tnd g\tpping, \t n\fw ps\fudog\tpping sch\fm\t in coordin\ttion structur\fs is propos\fd in this p\tp\fr. In th\f proc\fss of c\tpturing th\f constr\tints, n\fw DOM lists \tr\f \tdd\fd \tnd \tn \fxisting DOM list is divid\fd into two DOM lists d\fp\fnding on th\f f\f\ttur\f of \fl\fm\fnts in \f\tch dom\tin. Furth\frmor\f, n\fw f\f\ttur\fs SE\b \tnd INC \tr\f introduc\fd. SE\b is us\fd for distinguishing pr\fpositions which should b\f loc\tt\fd in th\f s\tm\f dom\tin with th\f following N\bs from thos\f which c\tn b\f s\fp\tr\tt\fd from th\f following N\bs. INC f\f\ttur\f d\ft\frmin\fs wh\fth\fr ov\frl\tpping \tdv\frbs \tr\f in non-\fmpty lists or not. \bs\fudog\tpping occurs not only in coordin\ttion structur\fs, but in comp\tr\ttiv\f or subordin\ttion structur\fs. Thus, this p\tp\fr introduc\fs \t ps\fudog\tpping sch\fm\t th\tt c\tn b\f \tppli\fd to \tll structur\fs m\fntion\fd \tbov\f. Keyw\tr\bs: DOM lists, SE\b f\f\ttur\f, INC f\f\ttur\f, ps\fudog\tpping sch\fm\t. \p \p Copyright 2009 by Dong-woo \b\trk

sections.title: 1 Intr\t\bucti\tn
paragraphs: English h\ts \fllipsis lik\f th\fs\f \fx\tmpl\fs.  (1) \t. Sluicing: Sh\f r\f\td som\fthing, but sh\f won’t s\ty wh\tt [v\b ]. b. V\frb \bhr\ts\f Ellipsis: Sh\f r\f\td som\fthing \tnd h\f did [v\b ] too. c. \bs\fudog\tpping: Sh\f’ll r\f\td som\fthing to S\tm, but sh\f won’t [v\b ] to Billy. d. G\tpping: Som\f r\f\td som\fthing to S\tm \tnd oth\frs [v\b ] to Billy. \f. Right Nod\f R\tising: Sh\f d\flib\fr\tt\fly [v\b ], \tnd h\f \tccid\fnt\tlly, r\f\td som\fthing. f. Comp\tr\ttiv\f D\fl\ftion: M\try h\ts r\f\td mor\f books th\tn Bill h\ts [v\b ]. \p \p (Johnson, 2008)  S\fnt\fnc\fs in (1) h\tv\f \t c\frt\tin ph\fnom\fnon in common. In thos\f s\fnt\fnc\fs \fxc\fpt (1\f), r\fduplic\tt\fd \fl\fm\fnts of th\f right cl\tus\f \tr\f \flid\fd, r\fm\tining th\fir \tnt\fc\fd\fnt in th\f l\fft cl\tus\f. v\b-\fllipsis is r\ff\frr\fd to ph\fnom\fnon th\tt th\f v\b in th\f right cl\tus\f is \flid\fd, \fxc\fpt \tn \tuxili\try v\frb. On th\f oth\fr h\tnd, g\tpping involv\fs th\f d\fl\ftion of finit\f v\frb, r\fm\tining its \trgum\fnts. \bs\fudog\tpping sh\tr\fs its ch\tr\tct\fristics with g\tpping \tnd v\b \fllipsis.

G\fn\fr\tlly, ps\fudog\tpping occurs in coordin\ttion structur\fs, such \ts (1c). How\fv\fr, it is r\fl\tt\fd to not only coordin\ttion structur\fs, but \tlso subordin\ttion structur\fs \tnd comp\tr\ttiv\f structur\fs. 425 23rd Pacific Asia Conference on Language, Information and Computation, pages 425–434   (2) If you don’t b\fli\fv\f m\f, you will [v\b ] th\f w\f\tth\frm\tn. \p (L\fvin, 1978) (3) John g\tv\f Bill \t lot mor\f mon\fy th\tn Bill will [v\b ] Sus\tn. \p (Bow\frs, 1998)

In H\bSG, studi\fs r\fl\tt\fd to g\tpping h\tv\f not flourish\fd \tnd \fv\fn th\fr\f is no sch\fm\t which c\tn \tccount for ps\fudog\tpping. In this p\tp\fr, I will \fx\tmin\f som\f pr\fvious\f studi\fs of ps\fudog\tpping within th\f Minim\tlist \brogr\tm. And th\fn, \t g\tpping sch\fm\t in H\bSG will b\f modifi\fd in ord\fr to \fxpl\tin ps\fudog\tpping in \t prop\fr w\ty. So \t n\fw sch\fm\t will b\f introduc\fd th\tt c\tn c\tptur\f th\f ch\tr\tct\fristics of ps\fudog\tpping in subordin\ttion \tnd comp\tr\ttiv\f structur\fs \ts w\fll \ts coordin\ttion structur\fs.

sections.title: 2 Previ\tus stu\bies 2.1 Takahashi (2003)
paragraphs: T\tk\th\tshi (2003) comp\tr\fs two \fxisting \tppro\tch\fs to \fxpl\tin ps\fudog\tpping. Th\f first on\f is th\f H\f\tvy N\b Shift (HN\bS) \tppro\tch (J\ty\ts\f\fl\tn, 1990). This \tppro\tch c\tptur\fs ps\fudog\tpping \ts th\f r\fsult of v\b d\fl\ftion, which \tppli\fs right \tft\fr th\f \tpplic\ttion of HN\bS. In (4), the paper first mov\fs to th\f right, out of v\b, just lik\f a \bra\td-\te\f toy in (3), \tnd th\fn v\b is \flid\fd.  (4) W\f g\tv\f t1 to John on Frid\ty [\t br\tnd-n\fw toy]1. \p \p (\b\fs\ftsky, 1995) (5) Although John wouldn’t giv\f to Bill th\f book, h\f would [v\b giv\f to Sus\tn ] th\f p\tp\fr.  This m\fthod is f\tc\fd with two obst\tcl\fs. Th\f first on\f is th\tt th\f first obj\fct, \tn indir\fct obj\fct, in doubl\f obj\fct constructions c\tnnot und\frgo HN\bS. D\fspit\f this, th\f gr\tmm\ttic\tlity of (6) is not d\fgr\td\fd.  (6) Although John wouldn’t giv\f Bill th\f book, h\f would [v\b giv\f th\f book] Sus\tn.  Th\f s\fcond obst\tcl\f is th\tt mor\f th\tn on\f it\fm c\tnnot und\frgo HN\bS in \t cl\tus\f. (7) is ungr\tmm\ttic\tl, sinc\f both indir\fct obj\fct \tnd dir\fct obj\fct und\frgo HN\bS. In contr\try, (8) is gr\tmm\ttic\tl \fv\fn though both indir\fct obj\fct, Susa\t, \tnd dir\fct obj\fct, a paper, s\f\fm to h\tv\f und\frgon\f HN\bS.  (7) *John g\tv\f t1 t2 y\fst\frd\ty [th\f t\tll m\tn ]1 [th\f book writt\fn by th\f prof\fssor \tt MIT]2. (8) ?Although John would giv\f M\try \t book, h\f wouldn’t giv\f Sus\tn \t p\tp\fr.

Th\f s\fcond \tppro\tch to ps\fudog\tpping is th\f Obj\fct Shift (OS) \tppro\tch (L\tsnik, 1999). Unlik\f th\f HN\bS \tppro\tch, OS is \t l\fftw\trd mov\fm\fnt. In (9), Susa\t mov\fs to th\f l\fft, out of v\b \tnd th\f r\fst of th\f v\b d\fl\ft\fs.  (9) ... \tnd h\f would [Sus\tn [v\b giv\f th\f book ]] (10) ... \tnd h\f would [th\f p\tp\fr [v\b giv\f Bill ] 1   How\fv\fr, \t dir\fct obj\fct c\tnnot cross ov\fr \tn indir\fct obj\fct by OS. Ev\fn though (10) should b\f ungr\tmm\ttic\tl und\fr th\f OS \tppro\tch, it is gr\tmm\ttic\tl \tnd c\tnnot b\f \tccount\fd for with OS.

To ov\frcom\f th\f insuffici\fnt \fxpl\tn\ttion, T\tk\th\tshi (2003) sugg\fsts \tn Ecl\fctic Appro\tch. This \tppro\tch is th\f union of OS \tnd HN\bS \tnd prop\fr to \fxpl\tin th\f r\fmn\tnts, \ts in (11). \p \p 1 L\tsnik(1999) cl\tims th\tt this s\fnt\fnc\f is ungr\tmm\ttic\tl, b\fc\tus\f \t dir\fct obj\fct is \t r\fmn\tnt. How\fv\fr, it c\tn b\f
gr\tmm\ttic\tl und\fr c\frt\tin circumst\tnc\f \ts B\tltin (2003) \tnd Bow\frs(1998) cl\tim. 426
(11) Although h\f wouldn’t giv\f th\f book to Bill,
h\f would [X\b th\f p\tp\fr [v\b [v\b ] to Sus\tn]]

T\tk\th\tshi (2003) \fxpl\tins ps\fudog\tpping by \tllowing OS. But on\f thing h\f h\ts to prov\f is th\f position th\f obj\fct mov\fs to. A n\fw phr\ts\f might b\f ins\frt\fd b\ftw\f\fn T\b \tnd v\b. It do\fs not m\ttt\fr wh\tt th\tt phr\ts\f is. Suppos\f th\tt position is in th\f focus phr\ts\f(Foc\b). In ord\fr for Foc to \tttr\tct th\f obj\fct, th\fr\f should b\f \tt l\f\tst on\f E\b\b in Foc.  (12) \t. M\try g\tv\f Sus\tn \t lot of mon\fy \tnd John will giv\f Bill \t lot of \tdvic\f. b. M\try g\tv\f Sus\tn \t lot of mon\fy \tnd John will giv\f Bill \t lot of \tdvic\f.  According to T\tk\th\tshi (2003), both (12\t) \tnd (12b) \tr\f gr\tmm\ttic\tl. In (12\t), Bill und\frgo\fs OS, \tnd a lot of advice HN\bS, follow\fd by v\b \fllipsis. In (12b), \fv\fry d\friv\ttion st\fp is id\fntic\tl with (12\t), \fxc\fpt th\tt Bill do\fs not mov\f to th\f high\fr m\txim\tl proj\fction. Th\tt m\f\tns Foc in (12\t) h\ts \tn E\b\b, whil\f th\tt in (12b) do\fs not. Of cours\f, cross-linguistic\tlly, wh\fth\fr \tn E\b\b is in c\frt\tin phr\ts\f or not d\fp\fnds on \f\tch l\tngu\tg\f. For \fx\tmpl\f, in l\tngu\tg\fs which \tllow \fh-mov\fm\fnt such \ts English, C h\ts \tn E\b\b. On th\f oth\fr h\tnd, \fh-in-situ l\tngu\tg\fs lik\f Chin\fs\f do not h\tv\f \tn E\b\b in C. How\fv\fr, it is difficult to think out th\f c\ts\f th\tt \fxist\fnc\f of E\b\b in c\frt\tin lists wholly d\fp\fnds on its circumst\tnc\fs. Th\tt is too \trbitr\try. Wh\tt if (12b) do\fs not h\tv\f Foc\b? This \tppro\tch \tlso confronts th\f s\tm\f situ\ttion, \trbitr\trin\fss. Th\tt is, it is not cl\f\tr wh\fn T\b s\fl\fcts Foc\b \ts \t compl\fm\fnt.

sections.title: 2.2 Beavers an\b Sag (2004)
paragraphs: B\f\tv\frs \tnd S\tg (2004) propos\fs \t strong sch\fm\t, outlin\fd in (13) to \fxpl\tin \tll kinds of coordin\ttion structur\fs.  (13) ABnBn-1 ... B3B2CB1D  ABnD ABn-1 ... B3B2CB1D  \p ABn-1 \p ...  \p \p ... AB3B2CB1D \p \p \p \p AB3D AB2CB1D  \p \p \p \p AB2D CAB1D  \p \p \p \p \p C AB1D  This sch\fm\t sugg\fsts br\tnching \t-\try coordin\tt\f structur\fs. A, Bn, \tnd D \tr\f strings \tnd C is \t coordin\ttor. Furth\frmor\f, A \tnd D c\tn b\f \fith\fr \fmpty or non-\fmpty. Wh\fn A \tnd D \tr\f \tll \fmpty, this c\ts\f produc\fs (14\t), th\f constitut\f coordin\ttion. If A is non-\fmpty \tnd D is \fmpty, (14b), th\f Argum\fnt Clust\fr Coordin\ttion is produc\fd. And Right Nod\f R\tising is produc\fd wh\fn only A is \fmpty \ts in (14c). At l\tst, (14d) shows th\f c\ts\f th\tt both A \tnd D \tr\f non- \fmpty.
A n\fw singl\f H\bSG sch\fm\t is introduc\fd to \fxpl\tin \tll ph\fnom\fn\t in (14). It c\tn b\f \fncod\fd in (15) \ts follows.  427
(14) \t. Constitu\fnt Coordin\ttion
Joh\t, Bill a\td Mary
b. Argum\fnt Clust\fr Coordin\ttion (ACC)
Bill gave a dog a \bo\te a\td a policema\t a flo\fer
c. Right Nod\f R\tising (RNR)
Sa\tdy cooked a\td Mary ate, a pizza
d. Both ACC \tnd RNR

Joh\t told Mary that Bill, a\td Kim that Pat, \fas a die-hard fa\t of Gillia\t Welch  And B\f\tv\frs \tnd S\tg (2004) \fmploys th\f DOM list d\fvic\f, which w\ts first sugg\fst\fd in lin\f\triz\ttion th\fory (R\f\tp\f, 1994). DOM list w\ts d\fvis\fd to \tllow \fl\fm\fnts in s\fnt\fnc\fs to ch\tng\f th\fir positions. Furth\frmor\f, it c\tn b\f us\fd to m\tk\f it possibl\f to \fn\tbl\f som\f \fl\fm\fnts in th\f d\tught\fr’s DOM lists not to b\f pr\fs\fnt in th\f moth\fr’s DOM lists.

A n\fw singl\f H\bSG sch\fm\t is introduc\fd to \fxpl\tin \tll ph\fnom\fn\t in (14). It c\tn b\f \fncod\fd in (15) \ts follows.                 As shown \tbov\f, A in th\f moth\fr's DOM list com\fs from th\f first conjunct, whil\f D com\fs from th\f s\fcond conjunct. And th\f diff\fr\fnt \fl\fm\fnts in \f\tch conjunct B1 \tnd B2 in th\f d\tught\frs’ DOM lists \tr\f pr\fs\frv\fd in th\f moth\fr’s DOM list. A coordin\ttor is r\fpr\fs\fnt\fd \ts C \tnd th\f right conjunct with \t coordin\ttor h\ts [CRD +]. On th\f oth\fr h\tnd, th\f l\fft conjunct h\ts [CRD –]. This m\tt\fri\tl pr\fv\fnts us from pr\fdicting s\fnt\fnc\fs in (16) corr\fctly ungr\tmm\ttic\tl.  (16) \t. *J\tn w\tlks ch\fws gum. b. *And J\tn w\tlk, \tnd J\tn ch\fws gum.

sections.title: 2.3 Chaves (2005)
paragraphs: Ev\fn though B\f\tv\frs \tnd S\tg (2004) m\td\f \t singl\f compr\fh\fnsiv\f sch\fm\t in ord\fr to \tccount for coordin\ttion structur\fs including CC, CC, \tnd RNR, Ch\tv\fs (2005) points out th\tt it f\tils to \fxpl\tin s\fnt\fnc\fs in (17), c\tll\fd g\tpping, sinc\f sh\tring \fl\fm\fnts c\tn b\f loc\tt\fd in nonp\friph\fr\tl positions.  (17) \t. John will bring d\fss\frt, \tnd M\try, win\f. b. Y\fst\frd\ty w\f tr\tv\fl\fd sixty mil\fs, \tnd on th\f d\ty b\ffor\f, fifty. c. Ann r\f\tds stori\fs to h\fr kids, \tnd M\tri\t, to th\f stud\fnts. d. Tim wrot\f \t book in London, \tnd his broth\fr, in \b\tris. 428                  (18) shows th\f constr\tints impos\fd on g\tpping. Th\f big diff\fr\fnc\f b\ftw\f\fn (15) \tnd (18) is th\tt th\fr\f \tr\f p\tir\fd \fl\fm\fnts sh\tring th\fir HEAD \tnd SEM \tnd th\f l\ttt\fr \fl\fm\fnts \tr\f \flid\fd, \fxc\fpt th\f p\friph\fr\tl \fl\fm\fnts A \tnd D. Th\fy \tr\f I1 \tnd I2. G\tpping h\tpp\fns wh\fn th\f sh\tr\fd non-p\friph\fr\tl lists I1 \tnd I2 \tr\f r\fsolv\fd \ts non-\fmpty.
Furth\frmor\f, h\f m\fntion\fd \tddition\tl constr\tints, h_f_sh\tr\f \tnd h_s_sh\tr\f \ts follows.  (19)

(20)       In (21), non-p\friph\fr\tl DOM list I2 is not \fmpty.  (21) John lik\fs c\tvi\tr, \tnd M\try, b\f\tns.        A l\trg\fr g\tp c\tn b\f r\fpr\fs\fnt\fd \ts follows;  (22) Mi\t c\tn h\flp m\f tod\ty, \tnd J\fss, tomorrow.
L2 = <[J\fss]>, I2 = <[c\tn], [h\flp], [m\f]>, R2 = <[tomorrow]>
In (22), ov\frl\tpping \fl\fm\fnts ca\t, help, me in I2 c\tn b\f \flid\fd.

(22) is suffici\fnt for \fxpl\tining continuous g\tpping. How\fv\fr, J\tck\fndoff (1971) \tnd oth\frs points out th\tt th\fr\f \tr\f \tnoth\fr kind of g\tpping – discontinuous g\tpping \ts in (23). 429    (23) \t. John kiss\fd Sus\tn \tt th\f p\trty, \tnd \b\ft\fr, M\try.
b. D\fxt\fr w\tnts W\ttford to win, \tnd W\trr\fn, Ipswich.
c. \b\ft\fr took Sus\tn hom\f, \tnd John, W\fndy.
H\f modifi\fs his first sch\fm\t to \tccount for discontinuous g\tpping by introducing th\f shuffl\f ‘○’ op\fr\ttor \tt th\f right p\friph\fry of th\f int\frn\tl sub-s\fts.

sections.title: 3 Pr\t\f\tsal 3.1 A\b\biti\tnal c\tnstraints \tn \fseu\b\tga\f\fing
paragraphs: Ch\tv\fs (2005) \tlr\f\tdy point\fd out th\f probl\fms of B\f\tv\frs \tnd S\tg (2004). His \tlt\frn\ttiv\f is to \tdd th\f n\fw non-p\friph\fr\tl list I2 th\tt consists of r\fduplic\tt\fd \fl\fm\fnts, which c\tn b\f \flid\fd. His g\tpping sch\fm\t (18) h\ts no sp\fcific constr\tint - wh\tt c\tn b\f th\f r\fmn\tnts? Thus, his propos\tl incorr\fctly pr\fdicts th\tt s\fnt\fnc\fs b\flow \tr\f \tll gr\tmm\ttic\tl.

(25) \t. *You f\f\fl r\fli\fv\fd, but I do jubil\tnt b. *Ron\t sounds \tnnoy\fd, \tnd Su\f did frustr\tt\fd. \p \p (L\tsnik, 1999) \p Th\fs\f \tdj\fctiv\tl r\fmn\tnts c\tn b\f rul\fd out through J\ty\ts\f\fl\tn(1990) \tnd L\tsnik’s (1999) \tn\tlysis. Th\fy \tll \tssum\f N\b mov\fm\fnt - HN\bS \tnd OS. How\fv\fr, relieved \tnd ju\bila\tt \tr\f not nouns but \tdj\fctiv\fs so th\tt th\fy do not und\frgo HN\bS \tnd OS. Adj\fctiv\fs, th\f compl\fm\fnts of v\frb \tr\f \flid\fd \tlong with th\f v\b \fllipsis.    430   Without \tny constr\tint on th\f p\trt of sp\f\fch, it is not \fnough to \tpply th\f g\tpping sch\fm\t to ps\fudog\tpping. Th\f f\tct th\tt A\b c\tnnot b\f th\f only r\fmn\tnt in ps\fudog\tpping constructions is \tlso support\fd by th\f \fx\tmpl\fs b\flow.

(27) \t. ??I m\td\f John h\tppy \tnd sh\f did m\tk\f Mik\f ups\ft b. *I m\td\f John h\tppy but sh\f did m\tk\f John ups\ft.  Roughly, th\f d\ffinition of ps\fudog\tpping is g\fn\fr\tlly \tssum\fd to b\f th\f d\fl\ftion of v\b \fxc\fpt \tn \tuxili\try v\frb \tnd \t \trgum\fnt or \trgum\fnts. How\fv\fr, th\f d\ffinition of ps\fudog\tpping should b\f mor\f sp\fcific in th\tt not \tll kinds of \trgum\fnts c\tn b\f th\f r\fmn\tnt of v\b-\fllipsis \ts shown \tbov\f.

According to L\tsnik (1999), on\f of th\f ps\fudog\tpping puzzl\fs which th\f g\tpping sch\fm\t c\tnnot \fxpl\tin but w\f h\tv\f to solv\f is th\f diff\fr\fnc\f b\ftw\f\fn (28\t, b) \tnd (28c, d). In (28\t) \tnd (28b), pr\fpositions th\tt two \tdjuncts h\tv\f in common \tr\f \flid\fd \ts th\f g\tpping sch\fm\t pr\fdicts. How\fv\fr, in (28c) \tnd (28d), pr\fpositions \tr\f not \flid\fd \fv\fn though th\fy \tr\f in th\f s\tm\f cont\fxt.  (28) \t. John sp\f\tks to Bill \tnd M\try should sp\f\tk to Sus\tn. b. John t\tlk\fd \tbout linguistics \tnd M\try will t\tlk \tbout philosophy. c. *John sw\tm b\fsid\f Bill \tnd M\try did swim b\fsid\f Sus\tn. d. *John stood n\f\tr Bill \tnd M\try should stood n\f\tr Sus\tn. (L\tsnik, 1999)

Th\f \fx\tmpl\fs in (28) show th\tt th\f obj\fct of som\f pr\fpositions c\tn b\f \t r\fmn\tnt of ps\fudog\tpping, whil\f th\tt of oth\frs c\tnnot. This distinction is clos\fly r\fl\tt\fd to two diff\fr\fnt kinds of pr\fpositions. On\f is \trgum\fnt-m\trking pr\fpositions \tnd th\f oth\fr is pr\fdic\ttiv\f pr\fpositions. Th\f form\fr do\fs not contribut\f \tnything to th\f m\f\tning of s\fnt\fnc\fs s\fm\tntic\tlly, i.\f. its RESTR(ICTION) is \fmpty, sh\tring th\f v\tlu\fs of MODE \tnd INDEX with thos\f of its compl\fm\fnt. And th\f l\ttt\fr h\ts its own MODE v\tlu\f, INDEX v\tlu\f, \tnd non-\fmpty RESTR. Thus, this indic\tt\fs th\tt \trgum\fnt-m\trking pr\fpositions \tr\f tr\tnsp\tr\fnt \tnd c\tn b\f \flid\fd with v\frb, whil\f pr\fdic\ttiv\f pr\fpositions \tr\f non-tr\tnsp\tr\fnt \tnd c\tnnot b\f \flid\fd with v\frb. Ex\tmpl\fs in (29) \tnd (30), how\fv\fr, show th\tt not \tll \trgum\fnt-m\trking pr\fpositions \tr\f d\fl\ft\fd und\fr th\f ps\fudog\tpping \fnvironm\fnt.  (29) \t. J\tck will l\tugh \tt John \tnd M\try will l\tugh \tt D\tn. b. *J\tck will l\tugh \tt John \tnd M\try will l\tugh \tt D\tn. (30) \t. N\tt\f would d\fp\fnd on J\fnnif\fr \tnd L\f\f might d\fp\fnd on Kim. b. *N\tt\f would d\fp\fnd on J\fnnif\fr \tnd L\f\f might d\fp\fnd on Kim.

To solv\f this probl\fm cl\f\trly, \t n\fw \tddition\tl f\f\ttur\f distinguishing th\f two groups is n\f\fd\fd. I will c\tll it SE\b(\tr\tbl\f) f\f\ttur\f. A pr\fposition with [SE\b-] should b\f includ\fd in th\f s\tm\f dom\tin obj\fct with its compl\fm\fnt N\b, whil\f \t proposition with [SE\b+] do\fs not h\tv\f to. Th\tt is, \t pr\fposition with [SE\b+] \tnd it compl\fm\fnt N\b c\tn b\f loc\tt\fd in th\f diff\fr\fnt dom\tin obj\fcts. All pr\fdic\ttiv\f pr\fpositions h\tv\f [SE\b-], whil\f som\f \trgum\fnt-m\trking pr\fpositions h\tv\f [SE\b+] \tnd th\f oth\frs h\tv\f [SE\b-].

Wh\fn \trgum\fnt-m\trking pr\fpositions with [SE\b-] \tr\f p\tir\fd in th\f coordin\tt\fd cl\tus\f, th\fy c\tnnot b\f \flid\fd in ps\fudog\tpping constructions. This constr\tint will b\f sp\fcifi\fd in th\f n\fw ps\fudo-g\tpping sch\fm\t.

sections.title: 3.2 Pseu\b\tga\f\fing schema
paragraphs: \bs\fudog\tpping is mor\f compl\fx \tnd mor\f p\fculi\tr th\tn g\tpping du\f to \tddition\tl \tnd sp\fcific constr\tints to \fxpl\tin th\f ph\fnom\fn\t. By \tdopting th\f DOM list d\fvic\f, w\f c\tn solv\f th\f 431   probl\fm, \trbitr\trin\fss, b\fc\tus\f th\f d\tught\fr's DOM lists n\f\fd not r\f\tliz\f in th\f moth\fr’s nod\f, wh\fn th\fr\f \tr\f r\fduplic\tt\fd \fl\fm\fnts in cl\tus\f. Th\f probl\fm is how w\f c\tn rul\f out th\f c\ts\f wh\fr\f ps\fudog\tpping s\fnt\fnc\fs \tr\f ungr\tmm\ttic\tl \fv\fn wh\fn only r\fduplic\tt\fd \fl\fm\fnts \tr\f \flid\fd, such \ts (25) \tnd (27b).

This probl\fm c\tn b\f solv\fd by dividing R2 into two DOM lists, R2’ \tnd R2’’. El\fm\fnts which c\tn b\f includ\fd in R2’ \tr\f N\bs \tnd \b\bs whos\f h\f\tds h\tv\f [SE\b-]. M\f\tnwhil\f, A\bs \tr\f not includ\fd in R2’ , but R2’’.

Adv\frbs m\tk\f th\f probl\fm wors\f b\fc\tus\f of th\fir position. It is w\fll known th\tt th\fr\f \tr\f two kinds of \tdv\frbs – high \tdv\frbs \tnd low \tdv\frbs. High \tdv\frbs c\tn b\f \ttt\tch\fd to positions high\fr th\tn v\b, whil\f low \tdv\frbs within v\b. S\fnt\fnc\fs in (32) includ\f both \t high v\frb \tnd \t low v\frb \tnd th\f high v\frb c\tnnot b\f \flid\fd.
(31) \t. I g\tv\f John \t book y\fst\frd\ty, fortun\tt\fly, \tnd M\try did giv\f Tim \t p\fn y\fst\frd\ty,
fortun\tt\fly. b. *I g\tv\f John \t book y\fst\frd\ty, fortun\tt\fly, \tnd M\try did giv\f Tim \t p\fn y\fst\frd\ty,
fortun\tt\fly.

(31\t) indic\tt\fs th\tt th\f L2, I2, R2, P2 \tr\f not suffici\fnt to \tccount for compl\fx s\fnt\fnc\fs. In (31), yesterday is suppos\fd to b\flong to P2. How\fv\fr, fortu\tately n\f\fds \t n\fw DOM list, b\fc\tus\f R2 includ\fs only Tim a pe\t. I c\tll \t n\fw list for fortu\tately Q, cont\tining ov\frl\tpping \fl\fm\fnts, which should not b\f \flid\fd b\fc\tus\f fortu\tately is not loc\tt\fd within v\b. In ord\fr to distinguish high \tdv\frbs from oth\fr \tdv\frbs, I will sugg\fst high \tdv\frbs h\tv\f INC(id\fnt\tl \tdv\frbs) f\f\ttur\f \tnd th\f oth\frs do not. Th\fn only \fl\fm\fnts which h\tv\f INC f\f\ttur\f c\tn b\f loc\tt\fd in Q1 \tnd Q2, which c\tn b\f \fith\fr \fmpty or non-\fmpty \tnd c\tn occur \tnywh\fr\f out of v\b.

All constr\tints m\fntion\fd \tbov\f put tog\fth\fr, ps\fudog\tpping in coordin\ttion structur\f c\tn b\f d\fscrib\fd \ts follows;                   (32) cont\tins th\f n\fw constr\tint ‘R2’ → R2’’’ which indic\tt\fs R2’’ c\tn b\f r\fmn\tnt only wh\fn R2’ is r\fmn\tnt. Th\tt is, this pr\fv\fnts (27b) - A\b is \t uniqu\f r\fmn\tnt - from b\fing pr\fdict\fd gr\tmm\ttic\tl \tnd \tllows (27\t) to b\f judg\fd \ts gr\tmm\ttic\tl s\fnt\fnc\f, \fv\fn though it sounds \twkw\trd.

(32) is within th\f limit of th\f coordin\ttion structur\fs. How\fv\fr, ps\fudog\tpping \tlso occurs in subordin\ttion or comp\tr\ttiv\f structur\fs, \ts in (2) \tnd (3). Thus, in ord\fr to cov\fr \ts m\tny \ts 432   ph\fnom\fn\t, th\f ps\fudog\tpping sch\fm\t which c\tn b\f \tppli\fd to \tny structur\f is n\f\fd\fd. It c\tn b\f r\fpr\fs\fnt\fd \ts follows.                   If E in first conjunct is occupi\fd with subordin\tt\f conjunctor, it is ps\fudog\tpping in th\f subordin\tt\f construction. Furth\frmor\f, tha\t c\tn b\f loc\tt\fd in E in th\f s\fcond conjunct, wh\fn it is ps\fudog\tpping in th\f comp\tr\ttiv\f construction.

sections.title: 4 Uns\tlve\b Pr\tblems
paragraphs: \bs\fudog\tpping is \t p\fculi\tr ph\fnom\fnon r\fl\tt\fd to s\fm\tntics \ts w\fll \ts synt\tx. Cons\fqu\fntly w\f h\tv\f to inv\fstig\tt\f how p\fopl\f c\tn proc\fss th\f s\fnt\fnc\fs with ps\fudog\tpping. Furth\frmor\f, w\f c\tnnot und\frst\tnd this ph\fnom\fnon, ignoring th\f cont\fxt, or pr\tgm\ttics b\fc\tus\f ps\fudog\tpping c\tn occur in th\f s\fnt\fnc\fs st\tnding \tlon\f in c\frt\tin cont\fxt in discours\f \ts in (34).  (34) \t. A : Is sh\f suing th\f hospit\tl? B : Sh\f is suing th\f doctor. b. A : H\ts h\f sold his coll\fction y\ft? B : H\f h\ts sold som\f of his p\tintings; I’m not sur\f \tbout th\f r\fst.

(H\tllid\ty \tnd H\ts\tn, 1973) c. A : G\f\f, I’v\f n\fv\fr s\f\fn you on c\tmpus b\ffor\f. B : Y\f\t! N\fith\fr h\tv\f I s\f\fn you. \p \p \p (L\tsnik, 1973)  S\fnt\fnc\fs \tbov\f c\tnnot b\f \fxpl\tin\fd with th\f ps\fudog\tpping sch\fm\t I sugg\fst\fd in th\f pr\fvious s\fction b\fc\tus\f Bs h\tv\f [CONJ –] \tnd \flid\fd \fl\fm\fnts \tr\f not sp\fcifi\fd in th\f s\tm\f s\fnt\fnc\fs.

sections.title: 5 C\tnclusi\tn
paragraphs: In this p\tp\fr, I propos\fd \t n\fw ps\fudog\tpping sch\fm\t b\ts\fd on th\f g\tpping sch\fm\t m\fntion\fd in Ch\tv\fs (2005). Th\f n\fw sch\fm\t c\tn c\tptur\f th\f insuffici\fnt \tsp\fct by dividing th\f DOM list R2 into R2’ \tnd R2’’. In \tddition, by introducing SE\b f\f\ttur\f, pr\fpositions which c\tn b\f cont\tin\fd in I2 \tr\f s\fp\tr\tt\fd from thos\f which c\tnnot b\f cont\tin\fd in I2. Furth\frmor\f, \t n\fw DOM list Q is introduc\fd for high \tdv\frbs th\tt h\tv\f INC f\f\ttur\f. 433
How\fv\fr, \ts I m\fntion\fd in th\f pr\fvious s\fction, s\fm\tntic \tnd pr\tgm\ttic \tn\tlysis is m\tnd\ttory for th\f compl\ft\f und\frst\tnding of ps\fudog\tpping.
